name: Fractal Viewer V2
headline: A standalone application that renders the Mandelbrot Set and Burning Ship fractals.
technicalPoints: Creating a fast super sampling algorithm to run on the CPU.
Making a preview feature to skip the long render times for a full image if it isn't desired.

name: Collections
headline: A web app to help users manage their collections of physical things, like books, CDs, other collectables, and share them with others.
technicalPoints: Modeling data to allow for user customization while not being too specific nor too general.
Choosing a balance between storing certain data attributes or relying on querires to fetch specific information.

name: Website + Contact Manager
headline: My own website! Built to display a portfolio of projects and introduce myself to other people and employers. Also faciliates contact requests through a backend.

name: Daemon
headline: A linux background process/daemon that acts as a personal assistant, managing emails, calendar dates, etc.
technicalPoints: Foregoing the conviniences of JavaScript and using C for processing web JSON data.
Linking CURL library to facilitate web requests

name: CUDA Fractal 2D
headline: A GPU accelerated version of the FractalViewerV2, with the goal of running in real time and eventually rendering 3D fractals also in real time.
technicalPoints: Intergrating CUDA and Opengl in a way that worked effectively and efficiently.
Sychronizing all aspects of the program, from user input on the CPU to rendering and drawing on the GPU.

name: BF Interpreter
headline: An interpreter/compiler system for the "Brainfuck" programming language.
technicalPoints: Working within the constraints of an intentionally difficult language.
